column6: Parental leave
column13: In Australia, Carsales provides its employees with 18 weeks paid for primary caregivers (with a bonus of 5 days of "Leave up Your Sleeve" when a primary caregiver returns to work to help them adjust to balancing work and home commitments). Four weeks of paid leave is also provided to secondary caregivers. Carsales also pays superannuation on its employer-funded parental leave and government-funded parental leave.
column20: Primary caregiver, paid leave, secondary caregiver

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
column7: Carsales aims to provide as much notice as possible when consulting employees regarding workplace change.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: The Workplace Health and Safety Policy applies to all of Carsales' employees, contractors, and anyone else in a workplace under its control. This policy is provided to all new team members when they join the company. It outlines the WHS management system, the WHS roles and responsibilities of everyone within the workplace, the management of contractors, and how consultation on WHS matters occurs.
column20: Workplace Health and Safety Policy, team member, WHS management system

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Carsales conducts regular assessments to identify risks, assess them using its risk rating matrix, and introduce suitable controls and continuous monitoring. Each of Carsales' global businesses has an incident reporting procedure under which team members must formally report all accidents, incidents, work-related illnesses and near misses by either filling out an incident report form, phoning a hotline, or emailing nominated representatives within the company.
column20: Regular assessment, risk rating matrix, suitable control

column6: Occupational health services
column13: Carsales offers a free Employee Assistance Program (EAP) to all team members globally. The EAP provides counselling on a wide range of topics, including dealing with personal issues, mental health, family and domestic violence, trauma, improving relationships, and substance abuse, as well as financial and legal counselling.
column20: Employee Assistance Program, mental health, trauma, counselling

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Carsales' WHS Committee meets quarterly and comprises representatives from across the company. The committee is responsible for promoting and fulfilling the objectives of Carsales' WHS management system and offers a consultative forum to address any health and safety concerns in the workplace.
column20: WHS Committee, WHS management system, consultative forum

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: Carsales' Australian and New Zealand WHS compliance training must be completed by all new starters during their onboarding and annually after that, and specialised WHS training is also provided annually for relevant roles as required Ã¢ÂÂ including manual handling and working in hot and cold conditions.
column20: WHS compliance training, onboarding, manual handling

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: Carsales' Chile Autos team runs the Club Program. The benefits program includes live online yoga and meditation classes, fitness classes and other online content to support exercise, nutrition and general health.\t
column20: Club Program, yoga class, general health

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: Many of Carsales' team members now work remotely, part-time or full-time, so Carsales must ensure their remote workspaces are safe. All new team members in Australia must complete a working-from-home checklist, which will highlight any potential risks that require remedying. Carsales also offers remote ergonomic assessments through a third-party provider when a team member makes Carsales aware of a potential hazard or issue in their home setup and provides home office equipment, such as ergonomic chairs or standing desks, as necessary based on the recommendations of those assessments.
column20: Ergonomic assessment, remote workspace, potential risk

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column7: In 2023, the occupational health and safety system covers 100% of Carsales' employees.

column6: Work-related injuries
column7: Carsales had no cases of injuries in 2023.

column6: Work-related ill health
column7: Carsales had no cases of ill health in 2023.

column6: Average hours of training per year per employee
column7: Carsales' total training hours in 2023 were 5,253 hours.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Carsales offers employees educational opportunities on how to save energy in their home office, such as considering switching to Greenpower or installing solar panels. Carsales also educates its staff on improving their waste management practices when working from home. The initiative will reduce working-from-home emissions by 20%.
column20: Educational opportunity, green power, waste management

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Carsales is proud to see its graduate and internship programs recognised by the Australian Association of Graduate Employers, named Carsales on the 2023 Top Graduate Employer and Top Intern Programs list, as voted by its graduates and interns. It is Carsales' fourth time appearing on the Top Graduate Employer list, placing first in the Technology category and second in Australia overall, and Carsales' second consecutive year on the Top Intern Programs list.
column20: Top Graduate Employer, graduate program, internship program

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Carsales' Australian business has a well-established graduate program to support and develop Technology and Data talent. The program welcomed its first cohort of graduates in 2018 and has continued to be a great pipeline of digital talent for the business.
column20: Technology and Data talent, graduate program, digital talent

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Carsales provides its people with big opportunities to make a big impact. One of the ways Carsales does this is through its Global Talent Exchange Program, launched this year. It is a unique opportunity for Carsales' team members to spend four weeks working with another team in one of its businesses around the globe.
column20: Global Talent Exchange Program, team member, another team

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The Carsales Technology Graduate program provides the opportunity to move through three six-month rotations, which allows graduates to explore different areas of the business. Graduates can work with a different team and manager and adapt to a new role, allowing them to learn new things.
column20: Technology Graduate program, graduate, different team, different manager

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In FY23, Carsales' Australian team launched a new career development initiative, Success Profiles, to further support the career growth of its people. Success Profiles was created in response to the growing need to provide Carsales' team members and managers with a more structured approach to career development conversations and provide greater clarity on the skills, competencies and behaviours required for the roles across the company.
column20: Success Profiles, career development, career growth

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Carsales' Australian team supports performance and career development through the Supercharge program, an in-house bespoke framework. At the framework's core are regular, fortnightly check-ins between each team member and manager. These are informal conversations to facilitate open dialogue about performance and expectations. Each quarter, a deep dive focuses on one of four topics Ã¢ÂÂ learning and development, career development, feedback and reflection.
column20: Supercharge program, career development, bespoke framework

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: One of the ways Carsales' Trader Interactive team in the United States supports the development of its people is by providing everyone with access to LinkedIn Learning. LinkedIn Learning is an on-demand online learning platform offering over 13,000 video courses taught by industry experts to develop technological, creative, and business skills.
column20: LinkedIn Learning, online learning, business skill

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Trader Interactive implemented a new manager training program, LEAD (Leadership Empowerment and Development), this year. The LEAD program is 14-16 weeks long and consists of e-learnings and live workshops touching everything from performance management to hiring and onboarding, recognising employees, and providing feedback. The team are currently working to have all existing managers complete the LEAD program, after which time they intend to roll out a version of the program to aspiring managers in FY24.
column20: LEAD program, e-learning, live workshop

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Carsales' Encar teams in South Korea delivered the Young Leaders program. The program is aimed at new managers and middle management, helping to create a foundation for these team members who are approaching a more senior level of responsibility within the business to develop their people management skills. Team Leaders and Executives who are already quite familiar with people management roles participate in leadership workshops, which help them develop important competencies such as influence, mentoring and vision to guide change.
column20: Young Leaders program, new manager, middle management

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In Brazil, Carsales' Webmotors team built its learning platform 'Minha Webmotors' (My Webmotors) to deliver training programs to all employees across the business. The courses offered are selected based on feedback from Webmotors' people, which they receive via a twice-yearly survey. The programs are available to all employees and aim to develop soft and technical skills, with specific development tracks available for leaders and individual contributors.
column20: Minha Webmotors, training program, technical skill

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Webmotors developed the Web Code Academy, a technical skills training program for Software Developers. The academy provides participants with an accelerated skills development pathway to help them assume more senior positions within the company. In the past year, the academy has supported the training of 25 developers.
column20: Web Code Academy, technical skills training, software developer

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Carsales continued to build on its Women in Tech (WIT) program throughout FY23 with the launch of WIT Virtual Coffee. This initiative provides a social space for networking and relationship building with other women in tech whom individuals may not have had an opportunity to connect with otherwise.
column20: Women in Tech, WIT Virtual Coffee, social space

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Carsales' Webmotors offers specialised product training for dealers via Webmotors University, a platform dedicated to keeping up-to-date with the latest trends in the automotive industry and providing training to thrive in the online vehicle marketplace. The training aims to support Webmotors' commercial customers.
column20: Webmotors University, automotive industry, training

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Carsales implemented the Inside Hustle initiative to support and nurture innovative ideas. Through this initiative, a team member with a great idea can pitch it to a nominated team and receive approval to work on the project outside of regular team planning, roadmaps, and guidance on how best to approach the task.
column20: Inside Hustle, an innovative idea, regular team planning

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In FY23, Carsales ran two hackathons, the most recent being its first global hackathon. The hackathons are themed "Voyager 2025, innovating to get there." Carsales saw a wide variety of ideas, including projects with an environmental focus, mobility and accessibility focus, and utilising AI to improve its services. Carsales' Hackathon track record shows that around 25-33 per cent of Hackathon projects go on to be developed into tangible product innovation for customers.
column20: Hackathon, environmental focus, AI

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column7: In 2023, 100% of Carsales' employees were subject to regular performance and career development reviews.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column7: In 2023, 39% of Carsales' workforce are female.

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column7: Carsales' gender pay ratio in 2023 was 1.04:1 for management positions.

column6: Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column13: All of Carsales' people, regardless of their role within the organisation, understand that they have a role to play in keeping the workplace safe. Carsales ensures that its people know this expectation via its policies, other ad-hoc communications, and annual compliance training. Carsales' Global Code of Conduct and Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO), Discrimination, Harassment and Workplace Violence Policies set out its standards of behaviour for how team members should behave towards each other and anyone else they deal with at work, and there are significant consequences for people who breach these standards. These policies also outline Carsales' formal grievance escalation and reporting procedures.
column20: Discrimination Policy, Equal Employment Opportunity, grievance escalation

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column7: Collective agreements are rare in Carsales's industry, as employees are engaged under individual contracts in predominantly professional roles. However, Carsales' employees are not restricted in their entitlement to freedom of association.

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column7: There were no cases of child labour in 2023.
